Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations) 

Family and Group Child Care Homes Licensing Rule R400.1919 on Communicable Disease

There are some new elements to the licensing rule on communicable disease for family and group child care homes. Select each flashcard to read more about licensing rules on communicable disease. 

Free of TB for those in household 14 yrs. & over

The applicant, licensee, all child care staff, all child care assistants, and members of the household 14 & over must have written evidence they are Tuberculosis free prior to caring for children

NO contact for those suspected of or confirmed communicable disease

Anyone living in the house or caring for the children shall not have contact with the children under care if they are suspected of or confirmed to have a communicable disease.

Notification to parents of children under care if minors living in the home are not current on immunizations

If the minors living in the house are not current on all Department of Health and Human Service required vaccinations, licensee shall inform parents of all children in care and personnel.

Documentation retained for 4 years

Finally, documentation required under this rule must be retained at the child care site for a minimum of 4 years.

Note for Child Care Centers, RULE R400.8128 states that centers must also keep on file evidence that staff and volunteers in contact with children are free of tuberculosis. 

The requirements under this rule are specific for licensed providers. However, these also serve as important recommendations for all license exempt providers to follow as well.
